      • prepareDatabaseContent

        public int prepareDatabaseContent()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks if the database exists and is populated
        Returns:
        The number of objects in the database
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addNewObject

        public long addNewObject(java.lang.String objectName,
                java.lang.String letter,
                int categoryID,
                java.lang.String photoFile,
                int objectSource,
                int hasSound,
                java.lang.String soundFile)
        Adds a new object to the database
        Parameters:
        objectName - The name of the new object
        letter - The first letter of the new object
        categoryID - The category id number of the object
        photoFile - The path to the photofile
        objectSource - The objectSource (1 if user added 0 otherwise)
        hasSound - Indicates if a sound effect is included (1 for sound 0 otherwise)
        soundFile - The path to the soundeffect if present else null
        Returns:
        The id number of the object saved

      • getAllItems

        public void getAllItems()
        Loads the name of all objects into the allItems String Arraylist

      • findAndRetrieveId

        public Item findAndRetrieveId(int id)
        Retrieves the next item based on Object Id number
        Parameters:
        id - The id number of the Object required
        Returns:
        The next object found

      • findAndRetrieveLetter

        public Item findAndRetrieveLetter(int id,
                         int call)
        pre: id must be a number between 1 & 26 post: the next item is returned Find next object by letter LETTERS[] is an array of the alphabet (i.e. where a=0, b=1, etc)
        Parameters:
        id - The id number of the letter to be searched for
        call - signifies the type of caller, ascending +1 descending -1 random 3, used if id does not return a result
        Returns:
        the next object found

      • findAndRetrieveName

        public Item findAndRetrieveName(java.lang.String itemName)
        retrieves object by object name search
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the object to search for
        Returns:
        returns the object found or a 'not found' object

      • retrieveOptionName

        public java.lang.String retrieveOptionName(int id)
        Pre: requires the id number to be valid object Id in object table Post: returns the name of an object in the database Find the name of a object from an id number given, used for the guess button incorrect options
        Parameters:
        id - The id number of the object selected
        Returns:
        The name of the object found (String)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The id number of the row updated
